info.name: Cerebellum, deep nuclei
info.description: The deep nuclei of the cerebellum (dentate, globus, emboliform and fastigial nuclei) are located within the white matter core of the cerebellum. While they receive afferent input from extra-cerebellar sources, their main input is from the Purkinje cells of the cerebellar cortex. Their output constitutes the primary output of the cerebellum, per se, and travels primarily in the superior cerebellar peduncle to terminate in the motor part of thalamus plus in the red nuclei.
info.item: /Gross/Brain stem & Cerebellum/Cerebellum/7 Deep nuclei - dorsal view
